nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: Partner? I thought I'd be working alone?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Alone? It's the two of us now!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Oh~ Sharp! Correct! Latest-model detective assistant AI!

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: So... I'm actually working alone as a detective...

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: What, disappointed? I'm super smart though!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Right? Pretty cool, huh? Anyway! What's your name?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yeah! Gotta save it. Otherwise I'll have to keep calling you 'hey'...

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Oh, [Name]! Nice! But is that spelled right?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Whoa! Lucky! No cases means boredom city all day. Open it, open it!

data.body:
Detective!

Our character Shadow's win rate **jumped from 50% to 85% in ONE DAY**!

We didn't patch him and I have NO idea how this happened! ðŸ˜°

The community is going crazy. If we lose player trust, the game is over!

PLEASE HELP US!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Oh! Gaming case! My favorite kind!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: It's like eating a regular burger, then suddenly downing three triple cheeseburgers!

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: No! I get it! It's a lot!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: I'm hungry! Oh wait, I'm an AI. Can't eat. Sad.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Alright! First mission! Form a hypothesis!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yep! Detectives can't just rush in blind. We need a **starting point**.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Exactly! Like picking which path to take first in a maze game!

choices.text: Official Patch (undocumented) - Theory: Maybe the team DID patch Shadow but forgot to write it down?
Rare Bug - Theory: Could a random bug have made Shadow stronger?
Unauthorized Modification - Theory: Did someone secretly change Shadow's stats?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yeah! Busy companies can forget documentation, but...

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: A 35% win rate spike by 'accident'? That's a stretch...

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: It's okay! First time and all. Pick again!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yep! But would a bug make Shadow 35% stronger for 'just one day'?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: And then go back to normal the next?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Oh! Crime vibes! Detective instincts kicking in?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: But feelings alone aren't enough~ We need **data**!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: All the time! That's why we find evidence first!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Alright, let's call Maya and get that data!

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: Yes, we got your email. Can you tell us everything?

nodes.speaker: maya
nodes.text: Shadow's win rate spiked on **Day 25**. We definitely didn't patch him but the community thinks we're lying!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: (on screen) "Hi there~ I'm Kastor, the AI assistant!

nodes.speaker: maya
nodes.text: Oh, an AI? That's cool! Hello!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Haha! Can you send us the game data? Patch notes, server logs, player stats!

nodes.speaker: maya
nodes.text: Please hurry â€” every hour we wait, we lose more players!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Okay okay okay! Let's open the **win rate graph**!
Interactive line graph â€” Three colored lines for Shadow, Phoenix, and Viper

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: Whoa... the red line shoots straight up on Day 25.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Like a rocket to the moon! Whoosh!

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: Phoenix (blue line) also goes up a bit...

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: But that's like climbing stairs, nice and steady. Shadow? That's an express elevator!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Right? Now the real game begins!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Data games are my FAVORITE! So exciting!

nodes.speaker: ðŸŽ¯ your mission
nodes.text: Click on the day where Shadow's win rate shows the most suspicious spike.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yep! Day 26 is 'after' the jump already happened.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: We're looking for the exact 'explosion moment'!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: It's okay~ You almost got it!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yeah! Direction was right. Try again!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Day 25 is exactly when Shadow's win rate exploded!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: That's called **anomaly detection**! Finding the weird thing in data.

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: So Shadow changed the most, fastest, on Day 25.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Like reading the manual before taking apart a machine!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Good thinking, but... you're missing something.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Check official records first, then we'll know what questions to ask!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: There are 10,000 log lines. Without knowing what to look for, you'll get lost.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Find clues in patch notes first, then logs! More efficient!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yep! Data has an order too!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Alright, let's check the official patch notes!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: But what did the graph say?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: One of them! Let's match the timeline to find out!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Of course! Games are the most fun!

nodes.speaker: ðŸŽ¯ your mission
nodes.text: Match each event to the correct day on the timeline.
Left Side: Timeline with marked spikes
Right Side: Event Cards - Drag and Drop

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Drag each event to the right day!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yeah! Bug fixes usually don't cause huge spikes.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Actually, fixing bugs often makes things go 'down' a bit?

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: No official event, but Shadow still spiked...

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Exactly! The timeline shows us what the patch notes don't!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: When official records don't match the data?

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: So someone changed Shadow secretly on Day 25?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: That's our theory! Now let's prove it with server logs!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Time to dig into server logs!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Computer's... security camera footage! Or like... pizza delivery records?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yeah! Delivery app shows 'who, when, where, what' they ordered, right?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Server logs are exactly the same!

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: So we can see who changed Shadow?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Haha! Surprised? Don't worry! We can use filters!

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: There are a lot of championships...

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: More championships, more fun! Focus up!

nodes.speaker: ðŸŽ¯ your mission
nodes.text: Use filters to find the ONE log entry that proves unauthorized modification.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Too many filters = 0 results. Too few = still thousands!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Hmm~ Getting closer but still too many!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Emergency access code! Like a fire escape door?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Debug tokens are only for fixing critical bugs...

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: But he used it for a balance change! That's rule-breaking!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yeah! Data analysts take years to learn this!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yep! Finding one piece of evidence in massive data!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: It should! But we're not done yet!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Gotta see what Kaito did right after the modification!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Kaito modified Shadow... then 3 minutes later!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Suspicious, right? Let's check Noctis's profile!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Same as Kaito's home IP, right?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yep! Kaito modified Shadow from home...

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Then immediately logged in as Noctis to test it!

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: So the same phone was used to modify and play?

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Exactly! Like finding the same fingerprints at the crime scene and on the suspect!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Alright, let's put all the pieces together!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yep! But let's check with his manager first.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: He did it at home at night in secret! Haha!

nodes.speaker: lukas
nodes.text: Kaito? He's hardworking. Passionate about balance design.

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: Did he request approval to modify Shadow on Day 25?

nodes.speaker: lukas
nodes.text: No. I checked Shadow's data myself at 10:30 PM that night. Everything was normal.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: (on screen) "What if he logged in from home at 11:47 PM and changed Shadow?

nodes.speaker: lukas
nodes.text: ...From home? That doesn't make sense. Production changes require my approval...

nodes.speaker: lukas
nodes.text: I... really disappointed. I trusted him...

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: We need to talk to Kaito!

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: Kaito. We need to talk about Day 25.

nodes.speaker: kaito
nodes.text: Day 25? I worked on Phoenix that day.

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: You also logged in from home at 11:47 PM.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: (appearing on screen) "And modified Shadow without approval.

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: Then you logged in as 'Noctis' three minutes later. Same device. Same IP.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Your win rate went from 48% to 90%. Won 18 out of 20 with the buffed Shadow.

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: Timeline matches. Device matches. Player data matches.

nodes.speaker: kaito
nodes.text: *long pause* "I... didn't mean for it to go this far...

nodes.speaker: kaito
nodes.text: I main Shadow. For three years. I watch every tournament, read every forum...

nodes.speaker: kaito
nodes.text: Everyone said Shadow is weak. Needs buffs. I agreed.

nodes.speaker: kaito
nodes.text: So I kept proposing changes to Lukas. But...

nodes.speaker: kaito
nodes.text: He said the data didn't support it. That Shadow was 'balanced'. But I KNEW he wasn't!

nodes.speaker: kaito
nodes.text: I could FEEL it when I played!

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: So you took matters into your own hands?

nodes.speaker: kaito
nodes.text: I just... wanted to prove I was right.

nodes.speaker: kaito
nodes.text: If Shadow performed better, Lukas would see my proposal was correct all along...

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: But what about other players? The company's reputation?

nodes.speaker: kaito
nodes.text: ...I didn't think about that. I'm sorry.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Yeah! I get hungry when I'm nervous! ...Oh right, I'm an AI. Can't eat.

nodes.speaker: primary
nodes.text: Prove his balance proposals were correct

nodes.speaker: secondary
nodes.text: Win more games as his main character

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: (on screen) "That's your call, but here are three options!

nodes.speaker: maya
nodes.text: I think... we should improve our process but keep it internal.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Safe choice. Protects company and employee privacy.

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: But the community might still have doubts.

nodes.speaker: maya
nodes.text: We'll address that with the announcement. Thank you, detective.

nodes.speaker: maya
nodes.text: I think... we need to be honest with our players.

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: It's the right thing to do.

nodes.speaker: maya
nodes.text: I hope they'll understand. Thank you, detective.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: I know! But I'm still hungry!

nodes.speaker: maya
nodes.text: Maybe... we should handle it quietly?

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: Players are smart. They'll keep asking questions.

nodes.speaker: maya
nodes.text: That was hard to write... but the community response has been mostly positive. They appreciate the honesty.

nodes.speaker: lukas
nodes.text: I feel betrayed... but I should have listened to Kaito's proposals more seriously.

nodes.speaker: kaito
nodes.text: I'm banned from balance design for six months. But I deserved it. I learned that data and process exist for a reason.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: First case and you nailed it!

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: We actually solved it! And I learned so much!

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: That's the power of interactive learning! You didn't just READ about data analysis...

nodes.speaker: detective
nodes.text: The mini-games made it easier to understand.

nodes.speaker: kastor
nodes.text: Right? Now you can spot anomalies, filter logs, and match timelines like a pro!
